sentence.Network_en: He would need all his authority to keep the weak-kneed volunteers from bolting.
sentence.Network_cn: 他需要动用所有的职权防止那些胆小的志愿兵逃跑。

sentence.Network_en: One glance at her, and both Hurstwood and Drouet saw plainly that she also was weak - kneed.
sentence.Network_cn: 赫斯渥和杜洛埃马上看出,她和别人一样, 也吓得膝盖发软了.

sentence.Network_en: The whole company was so weak - kneed that the lines were merely spoken, and nothing more.
sentence.Network_cn: 演员们个个腿脚发软,勉强背着台词, 一点儿表情也没有.

The Prime Minister sank, weak-kneed, into the nearest chair.中文意思:首相的膝盖软了下去,他瘫坐在了最近的椅子上。 以下为相关句子列表(点击查看,可以看.

entry.tran: 懦弱的;胆怯的;意志薄弱的
entry.def: If you describe someone as weak-kneed, you mean that they are unable or unwilling to do anything because they are influenced by a strong emotion such as fear.

example.ex: He would need all his authority to keep the weak-kneed volunteers from bolting.
example.tran: 他需要动用所有的职权防止那些胆小的志愿兵逃跑。

sentences.sentence: "the role of the dissenter is not for the weak-kneed"
